Name: Acquisition
Extra information: Alternative to LimeWire for Mac users; uses Cocoa GUI

Name: BearShare (pre v6.0)
Extra information: Since version 6: clone of the commercial iMesh software; does not connect to Gnutella and restricts downloads to media formats

Name: BitComet
Extra information: Exploits SuperSeeding and thus is often banned by trackers and peers. Compatible with e2DK links through an eMule plugin which gives access to eDonkey and Kad networks and cross-network sharing abilities with BitTorrent network.

Name: DC++
Extra information: Many modifications exist, for example: LinuxDC++, EiskaltDC++, FlylinkDC++, etc.

Name: eDonkey2000
Extra information: Discontinued

Name: eMule
Extra information: Supports protocol obfuscation

Name: FrostWire
Extra information: Fork of LimeWire, with no copyrighted-material blocker planned.

Name: giFT
Network[1]: OpenFT and, with plugins, Ares, Gnutella, FastTrack

Name: GNUnet / gnunet-fs
Extra information: Latest preview release: 0.11.0pre66 / June 6, 2018; 7 months ago (2018-06-06)[11]

Name: I2Phex
Extra information: Need I2P to run.

Name: I2PSnark[12]
Extra information: Integrated into I2P distribution.

Name: iMule
Extra information: needs I2P to run

Name: Jumpshare
Extra information: Real-time file sharing with built-in utilities for screenshots, screencasts, notes, and voice clips

Name: Kazaa
Extra information: Illegal in Australia.

Name: Kazaa Lite
Extra information: Adware-disabled version of Kazaa (fake versions in circulation)

Name: KCeasy
Extra information: Uses integrated giFT file sharing daemon as back-end.

Name: LimeWire
Extra information: Shutdown permanently due to injunction from MGM v. Grokster in which Limewire was ordered to disable all functionality of the software.[13]

Name: MLDonkey
Network[1]: BitTorrent, eDonkey, FastTrack, (Gnutella, Gnutella2), Kad; HTTP/FTP download
Extra information: P2P application, telnet / web-interface / GUI interface, complete and complex remote usage. Sancho GUI makes automatic SSH tunnels.

Name: Nachtblitz[15]
Extra information: needs I2P to run

Name: Nodezilla
Extra information: Most is proprietary, GUI is GPL.

Name: Perfect Dark
Extra information: Boards. Auto update.

Name: Retroshare
Extra information: Uses PGP for friend authentication. Decentralized F2F network type.

Name: Robert
Extra information: needs I2P to run

Name: Share
Extra information: Anonymous developer; tries to be Winny successor

Name: Shareaza
Network[1]: eDonkey, BitTorrent, Gnutella, Gnutella2, Direct Connect; HTTP/FTP download
Extra information: Uses a powerful files library; maintained by volunteer group

Name: StealthNet
Extra information: Evolution of the RShare client with many functions.

Name: Soulseek
Extra information: Folder downloads, browse users with folder trees, no multi-source downloads

Name: Tribler
Extra information: Unlike most other torrent clients, Tribler is decentralized (as well as anonymous) and does not rely on any trackers or any other indexing service to discover content.[21] Also features a built-in video streamer.

Name: Warez P2P
Extra information: Developer claims Warez v3.0 beta is malware-free

Name: WinMX
Network[1]: WinMX Peer Network (independent, now user-operated), OpenNAP, chatrooms supported
Extra information: Official development has ceased due to RIAA coercion. Versions 3.53, 3.54 beta 4 and older are available from 3rd parties.

Name: WireShare
Extra information: Forked from Limewire pro
